frame.name: Pattern
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame describes the interrelation of a collection of <fen>Entities</fen>; they may be physical entities or shapes in a recognizable configuration, a pattern of events, or a relation among abstract entities. The pattern is not the individual <fen>Entities</fen> nor the set of <fen>Entities</fen>, but an abstraction of their interrelations, as a gestalt.
<ex>The Cougers are playing in a <fex name="Name">Wing-T</fex> <t>formation</t> tonight.</ex> <ex>The auditors noticed a <fex name="Descriptor">suspicious</fex> <t>pattern</t> <fex name="Entities">of withdrawals from the maintenance account</fex> .</ex> <ex>The digits of irrational numbers do not repeat in any kind of <t>pattern</t></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Entities
FE.definition: <def-root>The entities whose interrelations form the pattern.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The name of the pattern, such as "wing-T".</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A descriptor of the pattern, such as "regular".</def-root>

lexUnit.name: pattern.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a configuration of entities, concrete or abstract

lexUnit.name: formation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an arrangement of entities forming a recognizable shape
